1400 // In newer MPQs, the (since Cataclysm BETA) the (attributes) file
1401 // contains additional 32-bit values beyond the sector table.
1402 // Their number depends on size of the (attributes), but their

1404 // but contain some sort of checksum in BETA MPQs

1420 memset(hf->SectorChksums, 0, hf->dwSectorCount * sizeof(DWORD));
1421 return ERROR_SUCCESS;

1424 {
1425 // Is there valid size of the sector checksums?
1426 if(hf->SectorOffsets[hf->dwSectorCount + 1] >= hf->SectorOffsets[hf->dwSectorCount])

1430 if(dwCompressedSize < sizeof(DWORD) || dwCompressedSize > hf->dwSectorSize)
1431 return ERROR_SUCCESS;

1434 dwCrcSize = hf->dwSectorCount * sizeof(DWORD);
1435 dwCrcOffset = hf->SectorOffsets[hf->dwSectorCount];
1436 RawFilePos = CalculateRawSectorOffset(hf, dwCrcOffset);
1437
1438 // Now read the table from the MPQ
1439 hf->SectorChksums = (DWORD *)LoadMpqTable(ha, RawFilePos, NULL, dwCompressedSize, dwCrcSize, 0, NULL);

541 // We require the block table to follow hash table

545 // That means that the hash table is compressed.

584
585 // In MPQ format 3.0, the entire header is optional
586 // and the size of the header can actually be identical
587 // to size of header 2.0

598 // 1) HET table

600 // 3) Classic hash table
601 // 4) Classic block table

610
611 // Size of the hi-block table
612 if(pHeader->HiBlockTablePos64)
613 {
614 pHeader->HiBlockTableSize64 = MaxOffset - pHeader->HiBlockTablePos64;
615 MaxOffset = pHeader->HiBlockTablePos64;
616 }
617
618 // Size of the block table
619 if(BlockTablePos64)
620 {
621 pHeader->BlockTableSize64 = MaxOffset - BlockTablePos64;
622 MaxOffset = BlockTablePos64;
623 }
624
625 // Size of the hash table
626 if(HashTablePos64)

628 pHeader->HashTableSize64 = MaxOffset - HashTablePos64;
629 MaxOffset = HashTablePos64;
630 }
631
632 // Size of the BET table
633 if(pHeader->BetTablePos64)
634 {
635 pHeader->BetTableSize64 = MaxOffset - pHeader->BetTablePos64;
636 MaxOffset = pHeader->BetTablePos64;
637 }
638
639 // Size of the HET table
640 if(pHeader->HetTablePos64)

643// MaxOffset = pHeader->HetTablePos64;

650 case MPQ_FORMAT_VERSION_4:
651
652 // Verify header MD5. Header MD5 is calculated from the MPQ header since the 'MPQ\x1A'
653 // signature until the position of header MD5 at offset 0xC0
654 BSWAP_TMPQHEADER(pHeader, MPQ_FORMAT_VERSION_4);

656 // Apparently, Starcraft II only accepts MPQ headers where the MPQ header hash matches
657 // If MD5 doesn't match, we ignore this offset. We also ignore it if there's no MD5 at all
658 if(!IsValidMD5(pHeader->MD5_MpqHeader))
659 return ERROR_FAKE_MPQ_HEADER;
660 if(!VerifyDataBlockHash(pHeader, MPQ_HEADER_SIZE_V4 - MD5_DIGEST_SIZE, pHeader->MD5_MpqHeader))

662

664 if((pHeader->ArchiveSize64 >> 0x20) == 0 && pHeader->HiBlockTablePos64 != 0)
665 return ERROR_FAKE_MPQ_HEADER;
666
667 // Is the "HET&BET" table tandem OK?
668 bHetBetOffsetOK = VerifyTableTandemPositions(ByteOffset,
669 pHeader->HetTablePos64, pHeader->HetTableSize64,
670 pHeader->BetTablePos64, pHeader->BetTableSize64,
671 FileSize);
672
673 // Is the "Hash&Block" table tandem OK?
674 bHashBlockOffsetOK = VerifyTableTandemPositions(ByteOffset,
675 pHeader->dwHashTablePos, pHeader->HashTableSize64,
676 pHeader->dwBlockTablePos, pHeader->BlockTableSize64,
677 FileSize);
678
679 // At least one pair must be OK
680 if(bHetBetOffsetOK == false && bHashBlockOffsetOK == false)
681 return ERROR_FAKE_MPQ_HEADER;
682
683 // Check for malformed MPQs
684 if(pHeader->wFormatVersion != MPQ_FORMAT_VERSION_4 || (ByteOffset + pHeader->ArchiveSize64) != FileSize || (ByteOffset + pHeader->HiBlockTablePos64) >= FileSize)
685 {
686 pHeader->wFormatVersion = MPQ_FORMAT_VERSION_4;
687 pHeader->dwHeaderSize = MPQ_HEADER_SIZE_V4;
688 ha->dwFlags |= MPQ_FLAG_MALFORMED;
689 }
690
691 // Recalculate archive size
692 if(ha->dwFlags & MPQ_FLAG_MALFORMED)
693 {
694 // Calculate the archive size
695 pHeader->ArchiveSize64 = DetermineArchiveSize_V4(pHeader, ByteOffset, FileSize);
696 pHeader->dwArchiveSize = (DWORD)pHeader->ArchiveSize64;
697 }
698
699 // Calculate the block table position
700 BlockTablePos64 = ByteOffset + MAKE_OFFSET64(pHeader->wBlockTablePosHi, pHeader->dwBlockTablePos);
701 break;
702
703 default:
704
705 // Check if it's a War of the Immortal data file (SQP)
706 // If not, we treat it as malformed MPQ version 1.0
707 if(ConvertSqpHeaderToFormat4(ha, FileSize, dwFlags) != ERROR_SUCCESS)
708 {
709 pHeader->wFormatVersion = MPQ_FORMAT_VERSION_1;
710 pHeader->dwHeaderSize = MPQ_HEADER_SIZE_V1;

720 // Handle case when block table is placed before the MPQ header

◆ DetectFileKeyBySectorSize()

DWORD DetectFileKeyBySectorSize ( LPDWORD  EncryptedData,
DWORD  dwSectorSize,
DWORD  dwDecrypted0 
)

Functions tries to get file decryption key. This comes from these facts

  • We know the decrypted value of the first DWORD in the encrypted data
  • We know the decrypted value of the second DWORD (at least aproximately)

  • There is only 256 variants of how the second key is modified

    The first iteration of dwKey1 and dwKey2 is this:

    dwKey2 = 0xEEEEEEEE + StormBuffer[MPQ_HASH_KEY2_MIX + (dwKey1 & 0xFF)] dwDecrypted0 = DataBlock[0] ^ (dwKey1 + dwKey2);

    This means:

    (dwKey1 + dwKey2) = DataBlock[0] ^ dwDecrypted0;

Definition at line 552 of file SBaseCommon.cpp.

553{
554 // We must have at least 2 DWORDs there to be able to decrypt something
555 if(dwSectorSize >= 0x08)
556 {
557 // Also try subsequent three values. This is because the value of the sector offset[0]
558 // could be higher than the total size of the sector table.
559 // Example MPQ: MPQ_2021_v1_CantExtractCHK.scx
560 for(DWORD dwDecrypted4 = dwDecrypted0 + 4; dwDecrypted0 < dwDecrypted4; dwDecrypted0++)
561 {
562 DWORD dwDecrypted1Max = dwSectorSize + dwDecrypted0;
563 DWORD dwKey1PlusKey2;
564 DWORD DataBlock[2];
565
566 // Get the value of the combined encryption key
567 dwKey1PlusKey2 = (EncryptedData[0] ^ dwDecrypted0) - 0xEEEEEEEE;
568
569 // Try all 256 combinations of dwKey1
570 for(DWORD i = 0; i < 0x100; i++)
571 {
572 DWORD dwSaveKey1;
573 DWORD dwKey1 = dwKey1PlusKey2 - StormBuffer[MPQ_HASH_KEY2_MIX + i];
574 DWORD dwKey2 = 0xEEEEEEEE;
575
576 // Modify the second key and decrypt the first DWORD
577 dwKey2 += StormBuffer[MPQ_HASH_KEY2_MIX + (dwKey1 & 0xFF)];
578 DataBlock[0] = EncryptedData[0] ^ (dwKey1 + dwKey2);
579
580 // Did we obtain the same value like dwDecrypted0?
581 if(DataBlock[0] == dwDecrypted0)
582 {
583 // Save this key value. Increment by one because
584 // we are decrypting sector offset table
585 dwSaveKey1 = dwKey1 + 1;
586
587 // Rotate both keys
588 dwKey1 = ((~dwKey1 << 0x15) + 0x11111111) | (dwKey1 >> 0x0B);
589 dwKey2 = DataBlock[0] + dwKey2 + (dwKey2 << 5) + 3;
590
591 // Modify the second key again and decrypt the second DWORD
592 dwKey2 += StormBuffer[MPQ_HASH_KEY2_MIX + (dwKey1 & 0xFF)];
593 DataBlock[1] = EncryptedData[1] ^ (dwKey1 + dwKey2);
594
595 // Now compare the results
596 if(DataBlock[1] <= dwDecrypted1Max)
597 return dwSaveKey1;
598 }
599 }
600 }
601 }
602
603 // Key not found
604 return 0;

740{
741 TMPQHash * pDeletedEntry = NULL; // If a deleted entry was found in the continuous hash range
742 TMPQHash * pFreeEntry = NULL; // If a free entry was found in the continuous hash range
743 DWORD dwHashIndexMask = HASH_INDEX_MASK(ha);
744 DWORD dwIndex;
745 USHORT Locale = SFILE_LOCALE(lcFileLocale);
746
747 // Set the initial index
748 dwStartIndex = dwIndex = (dwStartIndex & dwHashIndexMask);
749
750 // Search the hash table and return the found entries in the following priority:
751 // 1) <MATCHING_ENTRY>
752 // 2) <DELETED-ENTRY>
753 // 3) <FREE-ENTRY>
754 // 4) NULL
755 for(;;)
756 {
757 TMPQHash * pHash = ha->pHashTable + dwIndex;
758
759 // If we found a matching entry, return that one
760 if(pHash->dwName1 == dwName1 && pHash->dwName2 == dwName2 && pHash->Locale == Locale)
761 return pHash;
762
763 // If we found a deleted entry, remember it but keep searching
764 if(pHash->dwBlockIndex == HASH_ENTRY_DELETED && pDeletedEntry == NULL)
765 pDeletedEntry = pHash;
766
767 // If we found a free entry, we need to stop searching
768 if(pHash->dwBlockIndex == HASH_ENTRY_FREE)
769 {
770 pFreeEntry = pHash;
771 break;
772 }
773
774 // Move to the next hash entry.
775 // If we reached the starting entry, it's failure.
776 dwIndex = (dwIndex + 1) & dwHashIndexMask;
777 if(dwIndex == dwStartIndex)
778 break;
779 }
780
781 // If we found a deleted entry, return that one preferentially
782 return (pDeletedEntry != NULL) ? pDeletedEntry : pFreeEntry;
783}

512{
513 TMPQHeader * pHeader = ha->pHeader;
514 TMPQHash * pHashTable = NULL;
515 TMPKHash * pMpkHash;
516 TMPQHash * pHash = NULL;
517 DWORD dwHashTableSize = pHeader->dwHashTableSize;
518
519 // MPKs use different hash table searching.
520 // Instead of using MPQ_HASH_TABLE_INDEX hash as index,
521 // they store the value directly in the hash table.
522 // Also for faster searching, the hash table is sorted ascending by the value
523
524 // Load and decrypt the MPK hash table.
525 pMpkHash = (TMPKHash *)LoadMpkTable(ha, pHeader->dwHashTablePos, pHeader->dwHashTableSize * sizeof(TMPKHash));
526 if(pMpkHash != NULL)
527 {
528 // Calculate the hash table size as if it was real MPQ hash table
529 pHeader->dwHashTableSize = GetNearestPowerOfTwo(pHeader->dwHashTableSize);
530 pHeader->HashTableSize64 = pHeader->dwHashTableSize * sizeof(TMPQHash);
531
532 // Now allocate table that will serve like a true MPQ hash table,
533 // so we translate the MPK hash table to MPQ hash table
534 pHashTable = STORM_ALLOC(TMPQHash, pHeader->dwHashTableSize);
535 if(pHashTable != NULL)
536 {
537 // Set the entire hash table to free
538 memset(pHashTable, 0xFF, (size_t)pHeader->HashTableSize64);
539
540 // Copy the MPK hash table into MPQ hash table
541 for(DWORD i = 0; i < dwHashTableSize; i++)
542 {
543 // Finds the free hash entry in the hash table
544 // We don't expect any errors here, because we are putting files to empty hash table
545 pHash = FindFreeHashEntry(pHashTable, pHeader->dwHashTableSize, pMpkHash[i].dwName1);
546 assert(pHash->dwBlockIndex == HASH_ENTRY_FREE);
547
548 // Copy the MPK hash entry to the hash table
549 pHash->dwBlockIndex = pMpkHash[i].dwBlockIndex;
550 pHash->Locale = 0;
551 pHash->Platform = 0;
552 pHash->Reserved = 0;
553 pHash->dwName1 = pMpkHash[i].dwName2;
554 pHash->dwName2 = pMpkHash[i].dwName3;
555 }
556 }
557
558 // Free the temporary hash table
559 STORM_FREE(pMpkHash);
560 }
561
562 return pHashTable;

1054 if(!VerifyDataBlockHash(pbToRead, dwBytesToRead, pbTableHash))
1055 {
1056 dwErrCode = ERROR_FILE_CORRUPT;
1057 }
1058 }

1060 {
1061 dwErrCode = GetLastError();
1062 }
1063

1067 if(dwKey != 0)

1070 DecryptMpqBlock(pbToRead, dwCompressedSize, dwKey);

1093 }

738 pFileEntry = GetFileEntryLocale(ha, SIGNATURE_NAME, LANG_NEUTRAL);
739 if(pFileEntry != NULL)
740 {
741 // Calculate the begin and end of the signature file itself
742 pSI->BeginExclude = ha->MpqPos + pFileEntry->ByteOffset;
743 pSI->EndExclude = pSI->BeginExclude + pFileEntry->dwCmpSize;
744 dwFileSize = (DWORD)(pSI->EndExclude - pSI->BeginExclude);
745
746 // Does the signature have proper size?
747 if(dwFileSize == MPQ_SIGNATURE_FILE_SIZE)
748 {
749 // Read the weak signature
750 if(!FileStream_Read(ha->pStream, &pSI->BeginExclude, pSI->Signature, dwFileSize))
751 return false;
752
753 pSI->SignatureTypes |= SIGNATURE_TYPE_WEAK;
754 pSI->cbSignatureSize = dwFileSize;
755 return true;
756 }
757 }
758
759 // If there is extra bytes beyond the end of the archive,
760 // it's the strong signature
761 ExtraBytes = pSI->EndOfFile - pSI->EndMpqData;
762 if(ExtraBytes >= (MPQ_STRONG_SIGNATURE_SIZE + 4))
763 {
764 // Read the strong signature
765 if(!FileStream_Read(ha->pStream, &pSI->EndMpqData, pSI->Signature, (MPQ_STRONG_SIGNATURE_SIZE + 4)))
766 return false;
767
768 // Check the signature header "NGIS"
769 if(pSI->Signature[0] != 'N' || pSI->Signature[1] != 'G' || pSI->Signature[2] != 'I' || pSI->Signature[3] != 'S')
770 return true; //Not a valid signature, but another filetype could've been appended so not always an error.
771
772 pSI->SignatureTypes |= SIGNATURE_TYPE_STRONG;
773 return true;
774 }
775
776 // Succeeded, but no known signature found
777 return true;
778}

387 pbAttrFile = STORM_ALLOC(BYTE, cbAttrFile + 1);
388 if(pbAttrFile != NULL)
389 {
390 // Set the last byte to 0 in case the size should be 1 byte greater
391 pbAttrFile[cbAttrFile] = 0;
392
393 // Load the entire file to memory
394 SFileReadFile(hFile, pbAttrFile, cbAttrFile, &dwBytesRead, NULL);
395 if(dwBytesRead == cbAttrFile)
396 dwErrCode = LoadAttributesFile(ha, pbAttrFile, cbAttrFile);
397
398 // Free the buffer
399 STORM_FREE(pbAttrFile);
400 }
401 }
402
403 // Close the attributes file
404 SFileCloseFile(hFile);
405 }
406
407 return dwErrCode;
408}

647 // Save the first sector compression to the file structure
648 // Note that the entire first file sector will be compressed
649 // by compression that was passed to the first call of SFileAddFile_Write
650 if(hf->dwFilePos == 0)
651 hf->dwCompression0 = dwCompression;
652
653 // Write the data to the MPQ
654 dwErrCode = WriteDataToMpqFile(ha, hf, (LPBYTE)pvData, dwSize, dwCompression);
655 }
656
657 // If it succeeded and we wrote all the file data,
658 // we need to re-save sector offset table
659 if(dwErrCode == ERROR_SUCCESS)
660 {
661 if(hf->dwFilePos >= pFileEntry->dwFileSize)
662 {
663 // Finish calculating CRC32
664 pFileEntry->dwCrc32 = hf->dwCrc32;
665
666 // Finish calculating MD5
667 if(hf->hctx != NULL)
668 md5_done((hash_state *)hf->hctx, pFileEntry->md5);
669
670 // If we also have sector checksums, write them to the file
671 if(hf->SectorChksums != NULL)
672 {
673 dwErrCode = WriteSectorChecksums(hf);
674 }
675
676 // Now write patch info
677 if(hf->pPatchInfo != NULL)
678 {
679 memcpy(hf->pPatchInfo->md5, pFileEntry->md5, MD5_DIGEST_SIZE);
680 hf->pPatchInfo->dwDataSize = pFileEntry->dwFileSize;
681 pFileEntry->dwFileSize = hf->dwPatchedFileSize;
682 dwErrCode = WritePatchInfo(hf);
683 }
684
685 // Now write sector offsets to the file
686 if(hf->SectorOffsets != NULL)
687 {
688 dwErrCode = WriteSectorOffsets(hf);
689 }
690
691 // Write the MD5 hashes of each file chunk, if required
692 if(ha->pHeader->dwRawChunkSize != 0)
693 {
694 dwErrCode = WriteMpqDataMD5(ha->pStream,
695 ha->MpqPos + pFileEntry->ByteOffset,
696 hf->pFileEntry->dwCmpSize,
697 ha->pHeader->dwRawChunkSize);
698 }
699 }
700 }
701
702 // Update the archive size
703 if((ha->MpqPos + pFileEntry->ByteOffset + pFileEntry->dwCmpSize) > ha->FileSize)
704 ha->FileSize = ha->MpqPos + pFileEntry->ByteOffset + pFileEntry->dwCmpSize;
705
706 // Store the error code from the Write File operation
707 hf->dwAddFileError = dwErrCode;
708 return dwErrCode;
709}

1481 if(pFileEntry->dwFlags & MPQ_FILE_ENCRYPTED)
1482 EncryptMpqBlock(hf->SectorOffsets, dwSectorOffsLen, hf->dwFileKey - 1);
1483 BSWAP_ARRAY32_UNSIGNED(hf->SectorOffsets, dwSectorOffsLen);
1484
1485 // Adjust sector offset table position, if we also have patch info
1486 if(hf->pPatchInfo != NULL)
1487 RawFilePos += hf->pPatchInfo->dwLength;
1488
1489 // Write sector offsets to the archive
1490 if(!FileStream_Write(ha->pStream, &RawFilePos, hf->SectorOffsets, dwSectorOffsLen))
1491 return GetLastError();
1492
1493 // Not necessary, as the sector checksums
1494 // are going to be freed when this is done.
1495// BSWAP_ARRAY32_UNSIGNED(hf->SectorOffsets, dwSectorOffsLen);
1496 return ERROR_SUCCESS;
1497}
